item.title: HTTP 403 Forbidden
item.description: HTTP status code 403, or “Forbidden,” indicates that the server understands the client’s request but refuses to authorize it. Unlike a 401 status code, which signifies missing or invalid authentication, a 403 status means that the client’s credentials are recognized but they do not have permission to access the requested resource. This status is often encountered when a user tries to access a restricted area of a website or an API endpoint for which they lack the necessary privileges.
